{"step_by_step_thinking": "Epstein pearls are small, white, pearl-like spots often found in the mouths of newborns. They are not related to the gingiva, enamel, or epithelial rests. They are actually keratin-filled cysts and are harmless. They are not found in adults, nor are they related to enamel or epithelial rests.", "answer_choice": "A"}
